description: EventId: genTransAlarmIndicationSignal (1)

Severity: Major
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Alarm indication signal cleared' : 'Alarm indication signal detected'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TLAB-8600-FAULT-TRAPV2-MIB::genTransAlarmIndicationSignal TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySeqNum i 9999 TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryEventId i 9999 TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySetTime u 9999 TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySeverity i 1 TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceType i 1 TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceId s EXAMPLE TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceName s EXAMPLE TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryDescription s EXAMPLE TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryState i 1 TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryLastTime u 9999 TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryRefSeqNum i 9999 TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryServAffective i 1 TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::trapSwitchOverCounter c 9999

description: This variable represents the sequence number of an event
in the event history table. This table is indexed by
sequence number.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySeqNum

description: This variable represents the event ID which uniquely
identifies the event in the entire system. Equals to
the SPT of the event in Tellabs 8000 manager.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryEventId

description: This variable represents the time when the event was first
entered into the event history table, i.e. the number of
seconds since Jan 1, 1970 12:00AM.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySetTime

description: This variable dictates the urgency of action when a event
occurs. There are four severity levels - Critical, Major,
Minor, and Informational. Critical events are those, which
require immediate operator intervention to prevent/reduce
system down time. Major events require quick attention and
Minor events possibly require some attention. Informational
events indicate the occurrence of events that may need to be
investigated.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySeverity

description: This variable represents the type of InstanceId of a
particular event in the event history table. In brief
the instanceType refers to the type of sub-component
generating this event in the system. For additional
information refer to the instanceType textual
convention.
Currently not used but always returns only8600Cli.
AFFECTS: eventHistoryInstanceId,
eventHistoryInstanceName
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceType

description: This variable represents the InstanceId of a particular
event in the event history table. In brief the instanceId
refers to the sub-component generating this event in the
system. For additional information refer to the
instanceType textual convention.
Currently not used (see eventHistoryInstanceType)
DEPENDS ON: eventHistoryInstanceType
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceId

description: This variable specifies instance name as shown in CLI.
Always in 'SOURCE_GROUP: source' format, e.g. 'INTERFACE:
Physical fe5/1/1'. See TLAB-8600-FAULT-TRAPV2-MIB for
more information.
DEPENDS ON: eventHistoryInstanceType
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceName

description: This variable contains a detailed description of the event.
This is a free format alpha-numeric string that is set by
the entity generating this event. The maximum length of this
string is 255 characters.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryDescription

description: This variable represents the state of an event. In Tellabs 8600
network elements fault state is initially SET for persistent
(normal) faults and CLEAR when the fault situation is not
anymore on. Transient (delta) faults are always in CLEAR state.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryState

description: This variable represents the time when the state of the event
was last modified, i.e. the number of seconds since Jan 1,
1970 12:00AM. For persistent (normal) events this represents
the time when the event was CLEARed. For transient (delta)
events this is same as eventHistorySetTime as these events
are cleared automatically.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryLastTime

description: This variable represents the sequence number of the event in
the event history table that was generated when the event was
actually SET. This variable is actually used as a
cross-reference to the event that is CLEARED by this event.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryRefSeqNum

description: This variable indicates whether the event is service affective
or not
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryServAffective

description: If this is a redundancy system, then this object is
incremented once for every switchover occurrence.
Thus, this object can be used to determine/monitor
the current incarnation of the trap agent on the node.
IMPORTANT: This counter is reset to zero if the
system restarts (i.e. cold starts).
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::trapSwitchOverCounter

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : 'Signal looped back towards equipment'

description: EventId: genTransLossOfSignal (9)
Details: Signal is lost. Link is out of service or not
connected. For TDM IF, this is declared when
received signal has not had any transitions for a
period of time or the signal level is too low or
laser is switched off. For DSL IF, this means that
there is no signal level or line is in startup
state, or in idle state (SRU). (cLOS).
Severity: Critical
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Lost signal is recovered' : 'Signal is lost'

layer (partial SSF is caused e.g. if in ppp,
mplscp protocol fails but ipcp protocol is OK).
Severity: Critical
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

description: EventId: genTunnelPrimarySessionDown (21)
Details: Tunnel's primary session is down. However, since
this session may have been protected, it is
assumed here that data is still passing through.
If data passing is prevented for the whole tunnel,
separate fault is issued to indicate that.
Severity: Major
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: No

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Tunnel primary session is up' : 'Tunnel primary session is down'

Thus, this object can be used to determine/monitor
the current incarnation of the trap agent on the node.
IMPORTANT: This counter is reset to zero if the
system restarts (i.e. cold starts).
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::trapSwitchOverCounter

description: EventId: genTransExcessiveErrorASignalFail (23)
Details: This alarm is active when excessive error defect is
detected in the ingress signal and received signal
is set to AIS.
Severity: Critical
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Excessive error defect in the ingress signal is cleared' : 'Excessive error defect is detected in the ingress signal'

allowed to be reported for this MO.
Severity: Informational
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: No

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : 'Faults are masked'

description: EventId: genTransAlarmIndicationSignalCi (26)
Details: AIS-CI (Alarm Indication Signal in Customer
Installation) is a variant of AIS signal. It is
generated within the network and is transmitted
toward the network away from CI when either AIS or
LOF defect has been detected in the signal
received from the CI. It is used for fault
sectionalization.
Severity: Minor
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Alarm indication signal in customer installation is cleared' : 'Alarm indication signal detected in customer installation'

description: EventId: genTransRemoteAlarmIndicator (27)
Details: RAI alarm indicates that the far-end reveiver has
detected a fault. This causes ssf signal inside NE
due to bidirectionality of IP / MPLS layer.
Severity: Major
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: No

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Fault detected by far-end receiver is resolved' : 'Far-end receiver detected a fault'

description: EventId: genTransRemoteAlarmIndicatorCi (28)
Details: RAI-CI (Remote Alarm Indication Signal in Customer
Installation)is a variant of RAI signal. The
purpose of the RAI-CI is to indicate that the RAI
has been detected in the signal from the CI and
the defect or failure that caused the origination
of the RAI is not found in the signal from the
network. It is used for fault sectionalization.
Severity: Minor
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: No

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Remote alarm indication signal in customer installation is cleared' : 'Remote alarm indication signal detected in customer installation'

identifies the event in the entire system. Equals to
the SPT of the event in Tellabs 8000 manager.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryEventId

description: This variable represents the time when the event was first
entered into the event history table, i.e. the number of
seconds since Jan 1, 1970 12:00AM.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySetTime

description: This variable dictates the urgency of action when a event
occurs. There are four severity levels - Critical, Major,
Minor, and Informational. Critical events are those, which
require immediate operator intervention to prevent/reduce
system down time. Major events require quick attention and
Minor events possibly require some attention. Informational
events indicate the occurrence of events that may need to be
investigated.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySeverity

description: This variable represents the type of InstanceId of a
particular event in the event history table. In brief
the instanceType refers to the type of sub-component
generating this event in the system. For additional
information refer to the instanceType textual
convention.
Currently not used but always returns only8600Cli.
AFFECTS: eventHistoryInstanceId,
eventHistoryInstanceName
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceType

description: This variable represents the InstanceId of a particular
event in the event history table. In brief the instanceId
refers to the sub-component generating this event in the
system. For additional information refer to the
instanceType textual convention.
Currently not used (see eventHistoryInstanceType)
DEPENDS ON: eventHistoryInstanceType
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceId

description: This variable specifies instance name as shown in CLI.
Always in 'SOURCE_GROUP: source' format, e.g. 'INTERFACE:
Physical fe5/1/1'. See TLAB-8600-FAULT-TRAPV2-MIB for
more information.
DEPENDS ON: eventHistoryInstanceType
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceName

description: This variable contains a detailed description of the event.
This is a free format alpha-numeric string that is set by
the entity generating this event. The maximum length of this
string is 255 characters.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryDescription

description: This variable represents the state of an event. In Tellabs 8600
network elements fault state is initially SET for persistent
(normal) faults and CLEAR when the fault situation is not
anymore on. Transient (delta) faults are always in CLEAR state.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryState

description: This variable represents the time when the state of the event
was last modified, i.e. the number of seconds since Jan 1,
1970 12:00AM. For persistent (normal) events this represents
the time when the event was CLEARed. For transient (delta)
events this is same as eventHistorySetTime as these events
are cleared automatically.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryLastTime

description: This variable represents the sequence number of the event in
the event history table that was generated when the event was
actually SET. This variable is actually used as a
cross-reference to the event that is CLEARED by this event.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryRefSeqNum

description: This variable indicates whether the event is service affective
or not
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryServAffective

description: If this is a redundancy system, then this object is
incremented once for every switchover occurrence.
Thus, this object can be used to determine/monitor
the current incarnation of the trap agent on the node.
IMPORTANT: This counter is reset to zero if the
system restarts (i.e. cold starts).
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::trapSwitchOverCounter

description: EventId: genDormantResource (29)
Details: This resource is dormant i.e. not operational. This
is not supported in current operational mode.
Severity: Critical
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Resource is operational' : 'Resource is dormant'

description: EventId: genLosDetectionHwFailure (30)
Details: Loss of signal detection HW failure. Los state can
not be detected reliably.
Severity: Informational
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: No

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Lost of signal recovered' : 'Loss of signal detected due to HW failure'

description: EventId: genTunnelBypassDown (49)
Details: Whole bypass tunnel is down i.e. not operational
(typically session is not properly established)
Severity: Major
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: No

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Bypass tunnel is up' : 'Bypass tunnel is down'

description: EventId: atmLossOfCellDelineation (131073)
Details: Loss of cell delineation fault. This alarm is
active when loss of cell delineation is detected
in the ingress ATM interface. This alarm is not
valid for the atmInterface associated to
atmImaGroup where cell delineation is monitored
individually for each IMA links and is reported as
cLIF failure.
Severity: Critical
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Loss of cell delineation is recovered' : 'Loss of cell delineation is detected in ingress ATM interface'

description: EventId: atmImaAlarmLinkLif (131074)
Details: Loss of IMA links fault. The alarm indicates the
persistence loss of IMA frame (cLIF) defect at the
near-end. This is the consequence of loss of cell
delineation used for each in IMA link receiver
independently.
Severity: Critical
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Loss of IMA links fault resolved' : 'Loss of IMA links fault detected'

group symmetry or unsupported IMA version. The
near-end group is not operational.
Severity: Critical

ServAffective: Yes

seconds since Jan 1, 1970 12:00AM.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySetTime

description: This variable dictates the urgency of action when a event
occurs. There are four severity levels - Critical, Major,
Minor, and Informational. Critical events are those, which
require immediate operator intervention to prevent/reduce
system down time. Major events require quick attention and
Minor events possibly require some attention. Informational
events indicate the occurrence of events that may need to be
investigated.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySeverity

description: This variable represents the type of InstanceId of a
particular event in the event history table. In brief
the instanceType refers to the type of sub-component
generating this event in the system. For additional
information refer to the instanceType textual
convention.
Currently not used but always returns only8600Cli.
AFFECTS: eventHistoryInstanceId,
eventHistoryInstanceName
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceType

description: This variable represents the InstanceId of a particular
event in the event history table. In brief the instanceId
refers to the sub-component generating this event in the
system. For additional information refer to the
instanceType textual convention.
Currently not used (see eventHistoryInstanceType)
DEPENDS ON: eventHistoryInstanceType
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceId

description: This variable specifies instance name as shown in CLI.
Always in 'SOURCE_GROUP: source' format, e.g. 'INTERFACE:
Physical fe5/1/1'. See TLAB-8600-FAULT-TRAPV2-MIB for
more information.
DEPENDS ON: eventHistoryInstanceType
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceName

description: This variable contains a detailed description of the event.
This is a free format alpha-numeric string that is set by
the entity generating this event. The maximum length of this
string is 255 characters.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryDescription

description: This variable represents the state of an event. In Tellabs 8600
network elements fault state is initially SET for persistent
(normal) faults and CLEAR when the fault situation is not
anymore on. Transient (delta) faults are always in CLEAR state.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryState

description: This variable represents the time when the state of the event
was last modified, i.e. the number of seconds since Jan 1,
1970 12:00AM. For persistent (normal) events this represents
the time when the event was CLEARed. For transient (delta)
events this is same as eventHistorySetTime as these events
are cleared automatically.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryLastTime

description: This variable represents the sequence number of the event in
the event history table that was generated when the event was
actually SET. This variable is actually used as a
cross-reference to the event that is CLEARED by this event.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryRefSeqNum

description: This variable indicates whether the event is service affective
or not
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryServAffective

description: If this is a redundancy system, then this object is
incremented once for every switchover occurrence.
Thus, this object can be used to determine/monitor
the current incarnation of the trap agent on the node.
IMPORTANT: This counter is reset to zero if the
system restarts (i.e. cold starts).
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::trapSwitchOverCounter

description: EventId: atmImaAlarmGroupInsuffLinks (131086)
Details: IMA group near-end insufficient links fault. The
alarm indicates that minimum number of links (PTx
PRx) required to be active in the receive or
transmit direction for the near-end IMA group to
move into the Operational is not achieved.
Severity: Critical
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'IMA group near-end insufficient links fault resolved' : 'IMA group near-end insufficient links fault detected'

description: EventId: atmImaAlarmGroupTimingSynch (131089)
Details: IMA group timing synchronisation fault. The alarm
indicates that both far-end transmit clock mode
and near-end transmit clock are configured to ITC
mode which may cause timing loop.
Severity: Critical
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'IMA group timing synchronisation fault resolved' : 'IMA group timing synchronisation fault detected'

Details: The end-to-end or segment ATM AIS signal received.
End-to-end or segment alarm is distinguished based
on alarming object. TTP alarms end-to-end fault
and CTP segment fault.
Severity: Minor
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Segment ATM AIS signal cleared' : 'Segment ATM AIS signal detected'

description: EventId: atmInternalCacError (131093)
Details: The fault indicates that NE has detected an
internal CAC conflict in the ATM interface. During
the fault the interface is in such a state that
the CAC function has unexpectedly detected that
the existing configuration reserves more capacity
than the ATM interface has available. The
interface may silently drop user traffic. In the
normal conditions this state is absolutely
prevented by CAC function.One possible trigger to enter this state is SW
upgrade. The fault state may be eliminated using
one of the following actions: decreasing the CAC
reservations by deleting connections from ATM
interface or increasing the equivalent bandwidth
of the ATM interface by adding more active IMA
links to the IMA group, increasing the overbooking
factor or disabling CAC administration.
Severity: Critical
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Internal CAC error cleared' : 'Internal CAC error detected'

refers to the sub-component generating this event in the
system. For additional information refer to the
instanceType textual convention.
Currently not used (see eventHistoryInstanceType)
DEPENDS ON: eventHistoryInstanceType
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceId

description: This variable specifies instance name as shown in CLI.
Always in 'SOURCE_GROUP: source' format, e.g. 'INTERFACE:
Physical fe5/1/1'. See TLAB-8600-FAULT-TRAPV2-MIB for
more information.
DEPENDS ON: eventHistoryInstanceType
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceName

description: This variable contains a detailed description of the event.
This is a free format alpha-numeric string that is set by
the entity generating this event. The maximum length of this
string is 255 characters.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryDescription

description: This variable represents the state of an event. In Tellabs 8600
network elements fault state is initially SET for persistent
(normal) faults and CLEAR when the fault situation is not
anymore on. Transient (delta) faults are always in CLEAR state.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryState

description: This variable represents the time when the state of the event
was last modified, i.e. the number of seconds since Jan 1,
1970 12:00AM. For persistent (normal) events this represents
the time when the event was CLEARed. For transient (delta)
events this is same as eventHistorySetTime as these events
are cleared automatically.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryLastTime

description: This variable represents the sequence number of the event in
the event history table that was generated when the event was
actually SET. This variable is actually used as a
cross-reference to the event that is CLEARED by this event.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryRefSeqNum

description: This variable indicates whether the event is service affective
or not
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryServAffective

description: If this is a redundancy system, then this object is
incremented once for every switchover occurrence.
Thus, this object can be used to determine/monitor
the current incarnation of the trap agent on the node.
IMPORTANT: This counter is reset to zero if the
system restarts (i.e. cold starts).
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::trapSwitchOverCounter

description: EventId: eqmIncompatibleSwVersion (262153)
Details: This unit has incompatible SW version with referred
unit. Either this or referred unit SW should be
updated.
Severity: Critical
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Incompatible SW version alarm cleared' : 'Incompatible SW version detected'

sequence number.

occurs. There are four severity levels - Critical, Major,
Minor, and Informational. Critical events are those, which

Minor events possibly require some attention. Informational
events indicate the occurrence of events that may need to be
investigated.

particular event in the event history table. In brief
the instanceType refers to the type of sub-component

information refer to the instanceType textual
convention.
Currently not used but always returns only8600Cli.
AFFECTS: eventHistoryInstanceId,
eventHistoryInstanceName
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceType

description: This variable represents the InstanceId of a particular
event in the event history table. In brief the instanceId

variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceName

variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryDescription

description: This variable represents the state of an event. In Tellabs 8600
network elements fault state is initially SET for persistent
(normal) faults and CLEAR when the fault situation is not
anymore on. Transient (delta) faults are always in CLEAR state.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryState

description: This variable represents the time when the state of the event
was last modified, i.e. the number of seconds since Jan 1,
1970 12:00AM. For persistent (normal) events this represents
the time when the event was CLEARed. For transient (delta)

are cleared automatically.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryLastTime

description: This variable indicates whether the event is service affective
or not
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryServAffective

incremented once for every switchover occurrence.

system restarts (i.e. cold starts).

description: EventId: ethrDuplicateMacAddressRisk (327682)
Details: Interface is using old MAC address instead of
configured one and therefore there is a risk of
duplicate MAC address (currently used address is
different than physical and manual one). This can
happen when ELP protection is used and working
side IF module is replaced with new one and MAC
address is not reset.
Severity: Informational
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: No

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Duplicate MAC address risk resolved' : 'Duplicate MAC address risk detected'

ServAffective: No

identifies the event in the entire system. Equals to
the SPT of the event in Tellabs 8000 manager.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryEventId

description: This variable represents the time when the event was first
entered into the event history table, i.e. the number of
seconds since Jan 1, 1970 12:00AM.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySetTime

description: This variable dictates the urgency of action when a event
occurs. There are four severity levels - Critical, Major,
Minor, and Informational. Critical events are those, which
require immediate operator intervention to prevent/reduce
system down time. Major events require quick attention and
Minor events possibly require some attention. Informational
events indicate the occurrence of events that may need to be
investigated.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySeverity

description: This variable represents the type of InstanceId of a
particular event in the event history table. In brief
the instanceType refers to the type of sub-component
generating this event in the system. For additional
information refer to the instanceType textual
convention.
Currently not used but always returns only8600Cli.
AFFECTS: eventHistoryInstanceId,
eventHistoryInstanceName
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceType

description: This variable represents the InstanceId of a particular
event in the event history table. In brief the instanceId
refers to the sub-component generating this event in the
system. For additional information refer to the
instanceType textual convention.
Currently not used (see eventHistoryInstanceType)
DEPENDS ON: eventHistoryInstanceType
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceId

description: This variable specifies instance name as shown in CLI.
Always in 'SOURCE_GROUP: source' format, e.g. 'INTERFACE:
Physical fe5/1/1'. See TLAB-8600-FAULT-TRAPV2-MIB for
more information.
DEPENDS ON: eventHistoryInstanceType
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceName

description: This variable contains a detailed description of the event.
This is a free format alpha-numeric string that is set by
the entity generating this event. The maximum length of this
string is 255 characters.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryDescription

description: This variable represents the state of an event. In Tellabs 8600
network elements fault state is initially SET for persistent
(normal) faults and CLEAR when the fault situation is not
anymore on. Transient (delta) faults are always in CLEAR state.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryState

description: This variable represents the time when the state of the event
was last modified, i.e. the number of seconds since Jan 1,
1970 12:00AM. For persistent (normal) events this represents
the time when the event was CLEARed. For transient (delta)
events this is same as eventHistorySetTime as these events
are cleared automatically.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryLastTime

description: This variable represents the sequence number of the event in
the event history table that was generated when the event was
actually SET. This variable is actually used as a
cross-reference to the event that is CLEARED by this event.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryRefSeqNum

description: This variable indicates whether the event is service affective
or not
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryServAffective

description: If this is a redundancy system, then this object is
incremented once for every switchover occurrence.
Thus, this object can be used to determine/monitor
the current incarnation of the trap agent on the node.
IMPORTANT: This counter is reset to zero if the
system restarts (i.e. cold starts).
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::trapSwitchOverCounter

incremented once for every switchover occurrence.
Thus, this object can be used to determine/monitor
the current incarnation of the trap agent on the node.
IMPORTANT: This counter is reset to zero if the
system restarts (i.e. cold starts).
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::trapSwitchOverCounter

description: This variable represents the sequence number of an event
in the event history table. This table is indexed by
sequence number.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySeqNum

description: This variable represents the event ID which uniquely
identifies the event in the entire system. Equals to
the SPT of the event in Tellabs 8000 manager.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryEventId

description: This variable represents the time when the event was first
entered into the event history table, i.e. the number of
seconds since Jan 1, 1970 12:00AM.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySetTime

description: This variable dictates the urgency of action when a event
occurs. There are four severity levels - Critical, Major,
Minor, and Informational. Critical events are those, which
require immediate operator intervention to prevent/reduce
system down time. Major events require quick attention and
Minor events possibly require some attention. Informational
events indicate the occurrence of events that may need to be
investigated.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySeverity

description: This variable represents the type of InstanceId of a
particular event in the event history table. In brief
the instanceType refers to the type of sub-component
generating this event in the system. For additional
information refer to the instanceType textual
convention.
Currently not used but always returns only8600Cli.
AFFECTS: eventHistoryInstanceId,
eventHistoryInstanceName
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceType

description: This variable represents the InstanceId of a particular
event in the event history table. In brief the instanceId
refers to the sub-component generating this event in the
system. For additional information refer to the
instanceType textual convention.
Currently not used (see eventHistoryInstanceType)
DEPENDS ON: eventHistoryInstanceType
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceId

description: This variable specifies instance name as shown in CLI.
Always in 'SOURCE_GROUP: source' format, e.g. 'INTERFACE:
Physical fe5/1/1'. See TLAB-8600-FAULT-TRAPV2-MIB for
more information.
DEPENDS ON: eventHistoryInstanceType
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceName

description: This variable contains a detailed description of the event.
This is a free format alpha-numeric string that is set by
the entity generating this event. The maximum length of this
string is 255 characters.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryDescription

description: This variable represents the state of an event. In Tellabs 8600
network elements fault state is initially SET for persistent
(normal) faults and CLEAR when the fault situation is not
anymore on. Transient (delta) faults are always in CLEAR state.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryState

description: This variable represents the time when the state of the event
was last modified, i.e. the number of seconds since Jan 1,
1970 12:00AM. For persistent (normal) events this represents
the time when the event was CLEARed. For transient (delta)
events this is same as eventHistorySetTime as these events
are cleared automatically.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryLastTime

description: This variable represents the sequence number of the event in
the event history table that was generated when the event was
actually SET. This variable is actually used as a
cross-reference to the event that is CLEARED by this event.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryRefSeqNum

description: This variable indicates whether the event is service affective
or not
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryServAffective

description: If this is a redundancy system, then this object is
incremented once for every switchover occurrence.
Thus, this object can be used to determine/monitor
the current incarnation of the trap agent on the node.
IMPORTANT: This counter is reset to zero if the
system restarts (i.e. cold starts).

Physical fe5/1/1'. See TLAB-8600-FAULT-TRAPV2-MIB for
more information.
DEPENDS ON: eventHistoryInstanceType
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceName

description: This variable contains a detailed description of the event.
This is a free format alpha-numeric string that is set by
the entity generating this event. The maximum length of this
string is 255 characters.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryDescription

description: This variable represents the state of an event. In Tellabs 8600
network elements fault state is initially SET for persistent
(normal) faults and CLEAR when the fault situation is not
anymore on. Transient (delta) faults are always in CLEAR state.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryState

description: This variable represents the time when the state of the event
was last modified, i.e. the number of seconds since Jan 1,
1970 12:00AM. For persistent (normal) events this represents
the time when the event was CLEARed. For transient (delta)
events this is same as eventHistorySetTime as these events
are cleared automatically.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryLastTime

description: This variable represents the sequence number of the event in
the event history table that was generated when the event was
actually SET. This variable is actually used as a
cross-reference to the event that is CLEARED by this event.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryRefSeqNum

description: This variable indicates whether the event is service affective
or not
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryServAffective

description: If this is a redundancy system, then this object is
incremented once for every switchover occurrence.
Thus, this object can be used to determine/monitor
the current incarnation of the trap agent on the node.
IMPORTANT: This counter is reset to zero if the
system restarts (i.e. cold starts).
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::trapSwitchOverCounter

seconds since Jan 1, 1970 12:00AM.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySetTime

description: This variable dictates the urgency of action when a event
occurs. There are four severity levels - Critical, Major,
Minor, and Informational. Critical events are those, which
require immediate operator intervention to prevent/reduce
system down time. Major events require quick attention and
Minor events possibly require some attention. Informational
events indicate the occurrence of events that may need to be
investigated.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySeverity

description: This variable represents the type of InstanceId of a
particular event in the event history table. In brief
the instanceType refers to the type of sub-component
generating this event in the system. For additional
information refer to the instanceType textual
convention.
Currently not used but always returns only8600Cli.
AFFECTS: eventHistoryInstanceId,
eventHistoryInstanceName
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceType

description: This variable represents the InstanceId of a particular
event in the event history table. In brief the instanceId
refers to the sub-component generating this event in the
system. For additional information refer to the
instanceType textual convention.
Currently not used (see eventHistoryInstanceType)
DEPENDS ON: eventHistoryInstanceType
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceId

description: This variable specifies instance name as shown in CLI.
Always in 'SOURCE_GROUP: source' format, e.g. 'INTERFACE:
Physical fe5/1/1'. See TLAB-8600-FAULT-TRAPV2-MIB for
more information.
DEPENDS ON: eventHistoryInstanceType
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceName

description: This variable contains a detailed description of the event.
This is a free format alpha-numeric string that is set by
the entity generating this event. The maximum length of this
string is 255 characters.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryDescription

description: This variable represents the state of an event. In Tellabs 8600
network elements fault state is initially SET for persistent
(normal) faults and CLEAR when the fault situation is not
anymore on. Transient (delta) faults are always in CLEAR state.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryState

description: This variable represents the time when the state of the event
was last modified, i.e. the number of seconds since Jan 1,
1970 12:00AM. For persistent (normal) events this represents
the time when the event was CLEARed. For transient (delta)
events this is same as eventHistorySetTime as these events
are cleared automatically.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryLastTime

description: This variable represents the sequence number of the event in
the event history table that was generated when the event was
actually SET. This variable is actually used as a
cross-reference to the event that is CLEARED by this event.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryRefSeqNum

description: This variable indicates whether the event is service affective
or not
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryServAffective

description: If this is a redundancy system, then this object is
incremented once for every switchover occurrence.
Thus, this object can be used to determine/monitor
the current incarnation of the trap agent on the node.
IMPORTANT: This counter is reset to zero if the
system restarts (i.e. cold starts).
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::trapSwitchOverCounter

description: EventId: mplsPrimaryLspFrrActive (720904)
Details: Some part of primary LSP uses detour or bypass.
Severity: Major
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: No

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Primary LSP FRR active' : 'Primary LSP FRR inactive'

neither the normal source signal nor idle signal
is present.

InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Idle signal detection alarm cleared' : 'Idle signal detection alarm occurred'

Details: A Bit Error Ratio Low (BERL) alarm is declared when
the line BER is greater than or equal to the low
BER threshold and less than the high BER threshold.
Severity: Informational
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Bit error ratio low alarm cleared' : 'Bit error ratio low alarm occurred'

network elements fault state is initially SET for persistent
(normal) faults and CLEAR when the fault situation is not
anymore on. Transient (delta) faults are always in CLEAR state.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryState

description: This variable represents the time when the state of the event
was last modified, i.e. the number of seconds since Jan 1,
1970 12:00AM. For persistent (normal) events this represents
the time when the event was CLEARed. For transient (delta)
events this is same as eventHistorySetTime as these events
are cleared automatically.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryLastTime

description: This variable represents the sequence number of the event in
the event history table that was generated when the event was
actually SET. This variable is actually used as a
cross-reference to the event that is CLEARED by this event.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryRefSeqNum

description: This variable indicates whether the event is service affective
or not
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryServAffective

description: If this is a redundancy system, then this object is
incremented once for every switchover occurrence.
Thus, this object can be used to determine/monitor
the current incarnation of the trap agent on the node.
IMPORTANT: This counter is reset to zero if the
system restarts (i.e. cold starts).
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::trapSwitchOverCounter

description: EventId: pdhAbisAtrunkCongestionRecovery (786446)
Details: Abis sub-group is in congestion recovery state and
ACG has conditioned AIS to sub-group. This fault
is reported bi-directionally in both BSC and BTS
ends.
Severity: Major
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Abis sub-group recovered from congestion recovery state' : 'Abis sub-group is in congestion recovery state'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TLAB-8600-FAULT-TRAPV2-MIB::pdhAbisAtrunkCongestionRecovery TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySeqNum i 9999 TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryEventId i 9999 TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySetTime u 9999 TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySeverity i 1 TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceType i 1 TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceId s EXAMPLE TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceName s EXAMPLE TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryDescription s EXAMPLE TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryState i 1 TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryLastTime u 9999 TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryRefSeqNum i 9999 TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryServAffective i 1 TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::trapSwitchOverCounter c 9999

description: This variable represents the sequence number of an event
in the event history table. This table is indexed by
sequence number.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySeqNum

description: This variable represents the event ID which uniquely
identifies the event in the entire system. Equals to
the SPT of the event in Tellabs 8000 manager.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryEventId

description: This variable represents the time when the event was first
entered into the event history table, i.e. the number of
seconds since Jan 1, 1970 12:00AM.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySetTime

description: This variable dictates the urgency of action when a event
occurs. There are four severity levels - Critical, Major,
Minor, and Informational. Critical events are those, which
require immediate operator intervention to prevent/reduce
system down time. Major events require quick attention and
Minor events possibly require some attention. Informational
events indicate the occurrence of events that may need to be
investigated.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySeverity

description: This variable represents the type of InstanceId of a
particular event in the event history table. In brief
the instanceType refers to the type of sub-component
generating this event in the system. For additional
information refer to the instanceType textual
convention.
Currently not used but always returns only8600Cli.
AFFECTS: eventHistoryInstanceId,
eventHistoryInstanceName
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceType

description: This variable represents the InstanceId of a particular
event in the event history table. In brief the instanceId
refers to the sub-component generating this event in the
system. For additional information refer to the
instanceType textual convention.
Currently not used (see eventHistoryInstanceType)
DEPENDS ON: eventHistoryInstanceType
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceId

description: This variable specifies instance name as shown in CLI.
Always in 'SOURCE_GROUP: source' format, e.g. 'INTERFACE:
Physical fe5/1/1'. See TLAB-8600-FAULT-TRAPV2-MIB for
more information.
DEPENDS ON: eventHistoryInstanceType
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceName

description: This variable contains a detailed description of the event.
This is a free format alpha-numeric string that is set by
the entity generating this event. The maximum length of this
string is 255 characters.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryDescription

description: This variable represents the state of an event. In Tellabs 8600

description: If this is a redundancy system, then this object is
incremented once for every switchover occurrence.
Thus, this object can be used to determine/monitor

IMPORTANT: This counter is reset to zero if the

variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::trapSwitchOverCounter

description: EventId: pdhAbisAcompHighUtilizationSeconds15minLimitExceeded (786447)
Details: The delta type fault is issued when the number of
High Utilization Seconds counter has exceed the
configured threshold over the monitoring period.
The fault is reported uni-directionally by BSC and
BTS ACG.
Severity: Major
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'High utilization seconds counter threshold alarm cleared' : 'Number of high utilization seconds counter exceeded the configured 15min threshold'

the SPT of the event in Tellabs 8000 manager.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryEventId

description: This variable represents the time when the event was first
entered into the event history table, i.e. the number of
seconds since Jan 1, 1970 12:00AM.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySetTime

description: This variable dictates the urgency of action when a event
occurs. There are four severity levels - Critical, Major,
Minor, and Informational. Critical events are those, which
require immediate operator intervention to prevent/reduce
system down time. Major events require quick attention and
Minor events possibly require some attention. Informational
events indicate the occurrence of events that may need to be
investigated.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySeverity

description: This variable represents the type of InstanceId of a
particular event in the event history table. In brief
the instanceType refers to the type of sub-component
generating this event in the system. For additional
information refer to the instanceType textual
convention.
Currently not used but always returns only8600Cli.
AFFECTS: eventHistoryInstanceId,
eventHistoryInstanceName
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceType

description: This variable represents the InstanceId of a particular
event in the event history table. In brief the instanceId
refers to the sub-component generating this event in the
system. For additional information refer to the
instanceType textual convention.
Currently not used (see eventHistoryInstanceType)
DEPENDS ON: eventHistoryInstanceType
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceId

description: This variable specifies instance name as shown in CLI.
Always in 'SOURCE_GROUP: source' format, e.g. 'INTERFACE:
Physical fe5/1/1'. See TLAB-8600-FAULT-TRAPV2-MIB for
more information.
DEPENDS ON: eventHistoryInstanceType
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceName

description: This variable contains a detailed description of the event.
This is a free format alpha-numeric string that is set by
the entity generating this event. The maximum length of this
string is 255 characters.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryDescription

description: This variable represents the state of an event. In Tellabs 8600
network elements fault state is initially SET for persistent
(normal) faults and CLEAR when the fault situation is not
anymore on. Transient (delta) faults are always in CLEAR state.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryState

description: This variable represents the time when the state of the event
was last modified, i.e. the number of seconds since Jan 1,
1970 12:00AM. For persistent (normal) events this represents
the time when the event was CLEARed. For transient (delta)
events this is same as eventHistorySetTime as these events
are cleared automatically.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryLastTime

description: This variable represents the sequence number of the event in
the event history table that was generated when the event was
actually SET. This variable is actually used as a
cross-reference to the event that is CLEARED by this event.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryRefSeqNum

description: This variable indicates whether the event is service affective
or not
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryServAffective

description: If this is a redundancy system, then this object is
incremented once for every switchover occurrence.
Thus, this object can be used to determine/monitor
the current incarnation of the trap agent on the node.
IMPORTANT: This counter is reset to zero if the
system restarts (i.e. cold starts).
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::trapSwitchOverCounter

description: EventId: pdhAbisVoiceDegradedSeconds24h (786457)
Details: The delta type fault is issued when the number of
Voice Degraded Seconds counter has exceed the
configured threshold over the monitoring period.
The fault is reported uni-directionally by BSC and
BTS ACG.
Severity: Major
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Voice degraded seconds counter threshold alarm cleared' : 'Voice degraded seconds counter exceeded the configured 24h threshold'

description: EventId: pdhAbisSignallingCapacityExceed (786459)
Details: Signaling capacity has exceed the capacity of the
configured signaling VCC. Exceeding signaling
traffic is switched to over bearer path. The fault
is reported only by BSC end.
Severity: Major
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Signalling capacity threshold alarm cleared' : 'Signalling capacity exceeded the capacity of configured signaling VCC'

description: EventId: pdhAbisGroupOutOfService (786460)
Details: ACG is out of service.
Severity: Critical
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'ACG is in service' : 'ACG is out of service'

description: EventId: pdhAbisSubGroupOutOfService (786461)
Details: ACG sub-group is out of service due to the server
layer failure in E1 interface. This fault is
reported bi-directionally in the BSC and BTS end.
Severity: Major
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'ACG sub-group is in service' : 'ACG sub-group is out of service'

This is a free format alpha-numeric string that is set by
the entity generating this event. The maximum length of this
string is 255 characters.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryDescription

description: This variable represents the state of an event. In Tellabs 8600
network elements fault state is initially SET for persistent
(normal) faults and CLEAR when the fault situation is not
anymore on. Transient (delta) faults are always in CLEAR state.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryState

description: This variable represents the time when the state of the event
was last modified, i.e. the number of seconds since Jan 1,
1970 12:00AM. For persistent (normal) events this represents
the time when the event was CLEARed. For transient (delta)
events this is same as eventHistorySetTime as these events
are cleared automatically.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryLastTime

description: This variable represents the sequence number of the event in
the event history table that was generated when the event was
actually SET. This variable is actually used as a
cross-reference to the event that is CLEARED by this event.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryRefSeqNum

description: This variable indicates whether the event is service affective
or not
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryServAffective

description: If this is a redundancy system, then this object is
incremented once for every switchover occurrence.
Thus, this object can be used to determine/monitor
the current incarnation of the trap agent on the node.
IMPORTANT: This counter is reset to zero if the
system restarts (i.e. cold starts).
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::trapSwitchOverCounter

description: EventId: pdhLossOfAdaptiveTiming (786462)
Details: Loss of adaptive timing. Either converging takes
longer than expected or holdover state entered.
Severity: Major
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Adaptive timing loss recovered' : 'Adaptive timing loss detected'

description: This variable represents the sequence number of an event

sequence number.

description: This variable represents the event ID which uniquely

events indicate the occurrence of events that may need to be
investigated.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySeverity

description: This variable represents the type of InstanceId of a
particular event in the event history table. In brief
the instanceType refers to the type of sub-component
generating this event in the system. For additional
information refer to the instanceType textual
convention.
Currently not used but always returns only8600Cli.
AFFECTS: eventHistoryInstanceId,
eventHistoryInstanceName
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceType

instanceType textual convention.
Currently not used (see eventHistoryInstanceType)
DEPENDS ON: eventHistoryInstanceType

description: EventId: pppMultilinkMemberLinksDown (917505)
Details: One or more member links are operationally down.
Multilink bundle continues operation with the
remaining good links (if any).
Severity: Major
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Multilink member links are operational' : 'Multilink member links are down'

description: EventId: pppControlProtocolFailure (917506)
Details: A PPP control protocol has failed to open
connection or has left the opened state. This
fault is reported for NCPs that directly do not
open protocol (and thus not cause transport link
down fault) but negotiate additional functionality.
Severity: Major
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'PPP control protocol failure alarm cleared' : 'PPP control protocol failed'

one or more members. This fault is emitted if
difference action is report only.

InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Multiline maximum delay threshold alarm cleared' : 'Maximum configured delay between links exceeded in one or more members'

or not
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryServAffective

for speed and / or duplex. Either values are

autonegotiation. Thus passive interface is not
identical compared to active one.
Severity: Informational
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: No

much more than accept new downloaded software from
Manager. Set off when new SW is downloaded and
activated.

InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'All software files are activated' : 'All software files are deactivated'

Details: The clock selection process is not receiving any
proper clock signal (due to empty fallback list or
all clocks in fallback list are failed). Therefore
holdover clock is used.
Severity: Major
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: No

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Clock selection process received proper clock signal' : 'Clock selection process not received any proper clock signal'

occurs. There are four severity levels - Critical, Major,
Minor, and Informational. Critical events are those, which
require immediate operator intervention to prevent/reduce
system down time. Major events require quick attention and
Minor events possibly require some attention. Informational
events indicate the occurrence of events that may need to be
investigated.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySeverity

description: This variable represents the type of InstanceId of a
particular event in the event history table. In brief
the instanceType refers to the type of sub-component
generating this event in the system. For additional
information refer to the instanceType textual
convention.
Currently not used but always returns only8600Cli.
AFFECTS: eventHistoryInstanceId,
eventHistoryInstanceName
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceType

description: This variable represents the InstanceId of a particular
event in the event history table. In brief the instanceId
refers to the sub-component generating this event in the
system. For additional information refer to the
instanceType textual convention.
Currently not used (see eventHistoryInstanceType)
DEPENDS ON: eventHistoryInstanceType
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceId

description: This variable specifies instance name as shown in CLI.
Always in 'SOURCE_GROUP: source' format, e.g. 'INTERFACE:
Physical fe5/1/1'. See TLAB-8600-FAULT-TRAPV2-MIB for
more information.
DEPENDS ON: eventHistoryInstanceType
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceName

description: This variable contains a detailed description of the event.
This is a free format alpha-numeric string that is set by
the entity generating this event. The maximum length of this
string is 255 characters.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryDescription

description: This variable represents the state of an event. In Tellabs 8600
network elements fault state is initially SET for persistent
(normal) faults and CLEAR when the fault situation is not
anymore on. Transient (delta) faults are always in CLEAR state.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryState

description: This variable represents the time when the state of the event
was last modified, i.e. the number of seconds since Jan 1,
1970 12:00AM. For persistent (normal) events this represents
the time when the event was CLEARed. For transient (delta)
events this is same as eventHistorySetTime as these events
are cleared automatically.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryLastTime

description: This variable represents the sequence number of the event in
the event history table that was generated when the event was
actually SET. This variable is actually used as a
cross-reference to the event that is CLEARED by this event.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryRefSeqNum

description: This variable indicates whether the event is service affective
or not
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryServAffective

description: If this is a redundancy system, then this object is
incremented once for every switchover occurrence.
Thus, this object can be used to determine/monitor
the current incarnation of the trap agent on the node.
IMPORTANT: This counter is reset to zero if the
system restarts (i.e. cold starts).
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::trapSwitchOverCounter

description: EventId: sync1588Unlocked (1441802)
Details: The clock is unlocked to master.
Severity: Major
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Clock locked to master' : 'Clock unlocked to master'

description: EventId: tamCoolingFanNotRunning (1507329)
Details: Cooling FAN is not running. This may cause unit
overheating.
Severity: Major
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: No

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Cooling fan running' : 'Cooling fan not running'

InstId: N/A

This is a free format alpha-numeric string that is set by
the entity generating this event. The maximum length of this
string is 255 characters.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryDescription

description: This variable represents the state of an event. In Tellabs 8600
network elements fault state is initially SET for persistent
(normal) faults and CLEAR when the fault situation is not
anymore on. Transient (delta) faults are always in CLEAR state.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryState

description: This variable represents the time when the state of the event
was last modified, i.e. the number of seconds since Jan 1,
1970 12:00AM. For persistent (normal) events this represents
the time when the event was CLEARed. For transient (delta)
events this is same as eventHistorySetTime as these events
are cleared automatically.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryLastTime

description: This variable represents the sequence number of the event in
the event history table that was generated when the event was
actually SET. This variable is actually used as a
cross-reference to the event that is CLEARED by this event.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryRefSeqNum

description: This variable indicates whether the event is service affective
or not
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryServAffective

description: If this is a redundancy system, then this object is
incremented once for every switchover occurrence.
Thus, this object can be used to determine/monitor
the current incarnation of the trap agent on the node.
IMPORTANT: This counter is reset to zero if the
system restarts (i.e. cold starts).
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::trapSwitchOverCounter

description: EventId: tamHwIngressLinksUsageOverflow (1507344)
Details: Internal Ingress Links usage overflow. You have
suffered lack of resources with ingress IP routes
and/or some ingress MPLS statistic collection. The
fault stays on until side-effects have been
corrected.
Severity: Critical
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: No

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Internal ingress link usage overflow problem resolved' : 'Internal ingress link usage overflow detected'

description: This variable represents the sequence number of an event
in the event history table. This table is indexed by
sequence number.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySeqNum

description: This variable represents the event ID which uniquely

occurs. There are four severity levels - Critical, Major,
Minor, and Informational. Critical events are those, which
require immediate operator intervention to prevent/reduce
system down time. Major events require quick attention and
Minor events possibly require some attention. Informational
events indicate the occurrence of events that may need to be
investigated.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySeverity

description: This variable represents the type of InstanceId of a
particular event in the event history table. In brief
the instanceType refers to the type of sub-component
generating this event in the system. For additional
information refer to the instanceType textual
convention.
Currently not used but always returns only8600Cli.
AFFECTS: eventHistoryInstanceId,
eventHistoryInstanceName
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceType

DEPENDS ON: eventHistoryInstanceType

in the event history table. This table is indexed by
sequence number.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySeqNum

description: This variable represents the event ID which uniquely
identifies the event in the entire system. Equals to
the SPT of the event in Tellabs 8000 manager.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryEventId

description: This variable represents the time when the event was first
entered into the event history table, i.e. the number of
seconds since Jan 1, 1970 12:00AM.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySetTime

description: This variable dictates the urgency of action when a event
occurs. There are four severity levels - Critical, Major,
Minor, and Informational. Critical events are those, which
require immediate operator intervention to prevent/reduce
system down time. Major events require quick attention and
Minor events possibly require some attention. Informational
events indicate the occurrence of events that may need to be
investigated.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistorySeverity

description: This variable represents the type of InstanceId of a
particular event in the event history table. In brief
the instanceType refers to the type of sub-component
generating this event in the system. For additional
information refer to the instanceType textual
convention.
Currently not used but always returns only8600Cli.
AFFECTS: eventHistoryInstanceId,
eventHistoryInstanceName
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceType

description: This variable represents the InstanceId of a particular
event in the event history table. In brief the instanceId
refers to the sub-component generating this event in the
system. For additional information refer to the
instanceType textual convention.
Currently not used (see eventHistoryInstanceType)
DEPENDS ON: eventHistoryInstanceType
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceId

description: This variable specifies instance name as shown in CLI.
Always in 'SOURCE_GROUP: source' format, e.g. 'INTERFACE:
Physical fe5/1/1'. See TLAB-8600-FAULT-TRAPV2-MIB for
more information.
DEPENDS ON: eventHistoryInstanceType
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryInstanceName

description: This variable contains a detailed description of the event.
This is a free format alpha-numeric string that is set by
the entity generating this event. The maximum length of this
string is 255 characters.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryDescription

description: This variable represents the state of an event. In Tellabs 8600
network elements fault state is initially SET for persistent
(normal) faults and CLEAR when the fault situation is not
anymore on. Transient (delta) faults are always in CLEAR state.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryState

description: This variable represents the time when the state of the event
was last modified, i.e. the number of seconds since Jan 1,
1970 12:00AM. For persistent (normal) events this represents
the time when the event was CLEARed. For transient (delta)
events this is same as eventHistorySetTime as these events
are cleared automatically.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryLastTime

description: This variable represents the sequence number of the event in
the event history table that was generated when the event was
actually SET. This variable is actually used as a
cross-reference to the event that is CLEARED by this event.
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryRefSeqNum

description: This variable indicates whether the event is service affective
or not
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::eventHistoryServAffective

description: If this is a redundancy system, then this object is
incremented once for every switchover occurrence.
Thus, this object can be used to determine/monitor
the current incarnation of the trap agent on the node.
IMPORTANT: This counter is reset to zero if the
system restarts (i.e. cold starts).
variables.name: TLAB-8600-FAULT-MIB::trapSwitchOverCounter

description: EventId: eqsCpuCacheFailure (1703946)
Details: CPU cache is not working properly due to HW failure
and is turned off. Some behavior may be slower
that normally, but otherwise system should work OK.
Severity: Major
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: No

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'CPU cache working properly' : 'CPU cache not working properly due to HW failure'

description: EventId: eqsBackplaneSlotIdReadingFailure (1703947)
Details: Reading slot id from backplane partly failed due to
parity errors. For now the correct value was able
to be deduced and system functions OK. Original HW
problem though exist.
Severity: Major
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: No

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Backplane slot ID reading failure alarm cleared' : 'Backplane slot ID reading failed'

description: EventId: eqsHwFailure (1703948)
Details: An unspecified HW problem detected. If only one
side of protected entity is faulty, then the
severity is lowered to major.
Severity: Critical
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'HW failure alarm cleared' : 'HW failed'

description: EventId: eqsPacketBufferRamFailure (1703949)
Details: Packet buffer RAM is faulty. Some packets may be
corrupted. If only one side of protected entity is
faulty, then the severity is lowered to major.
Severity: Critical
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Packet buffer RAM fault alarm cleared' : 'Packet buffer RAM is faulty'

description: EventId: eqsPacketBufferQueueManagerFailure (1703950)
Details: Packet buffer Queue Manager has detected HW
failure. Traffic interruptions and unreliable
forwarding may occur. If only one side of
protected entity is faulty, then the severity is
lowered to major.
Severity: Critical
InstType: N/A
InstId: N/A
InstName: N/A
ServAffective: Yes

Summary.eval: ($v8 ne '') ? '$v8' : ($v9==3) ? 'Packet buffer queue manager HW failure alarm cleared' : 'Packet buffer queue manager detected HW failure'

was last modified, i.e. the number of seconds since Jan 1,
1970 12:00AM. For persistent (normal) events this represents

system restarts (i.e. cold starts).

or not
